Study MBBS in Abroad at MCI Approved Medical Universities

  • Courses provided by Medical Colleges in Karnataka
  • Total number of Medical Colleges in Karnataka

  • Placement in medical colleges in Karnataka

Karnataka is one of the best destinations for the candidates who seeking for admission in medical courses because of high-quality medical education equipped with world-class infrastructure and hospitals. It is truly a rewarding investment of time, finance and career acquisition to study in medical colleges in Karnataka.

Medical colleges in Karnataka provide magnificent theoretical as well as practical education which empowers the candidates to become successful practitioners. They enable the students to have brighter career growth after pursuing medical courses and provide the best education at affordable rates.

{/* */}

Courses provided by Medical Colleges in Karnataka

  • MBBS (Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery)
  • BDS (Bachelor of Dental Surgery)
  • DGO (Diploma in Gynecology and Obstetrics)
  • Master of Surgery
  • Doctor of medicine
  • B.SC (Bachelor of Science)
  • BHMS (Bachelor of Homeopathic Medicine and Surgery)

Total number of Medical Colleges in Karnataka

Government Medical Colleges in Karnataka

  • Total MBBS Colleges in Karnataka: 41
  • Total MBBS Seats in Karnataka: 6595

Private Medical Colleges in Karnataka

  • Total MBBS Colleges in Karnataka: 60
  • Total MBBS Seats available in Karnataka: 9495

Admission procedure in Medical colleges in Karnataka

The students who are seeking admission to the courses offered by Medical colleges in Karnataka can apply through both online as well as offline mode. Here is some essential information regarding admissions:

  • The students should have aggregate 50% marks in physics, chemistry, and biology in the 12th standard.
  • The minimum required percentage for SC/ST candidates of Karnataka origin is 40%.
  • The students should have English subject in their higher secondary.
  • The students should be at least 17 years of age on or before 31st December of the admission year.
  • The students must not be more than 25 years of age.
  • The students need to qualify for the NEET entrance examination conducted by the (NTA) National Testing Agency with the minimum required percentage.
Infrastructure and facilities provided by Medical Colleges in Karnataka

Medical colleges in Karnataka are well-known for excellent infrastructure and facilities.

  • They have the best faculty members with a multidisciplinary skill set of different aspects of science with an average experience of 10-15 years.
  • Medical colleges in Karnataka have modern teaching techniques with outstanding facilities equipped with the well-established infrastructure.
  • They utilize up-to-date machinery in their laboratories.
  • They have spacious lecture halls and well-equipped digital library facilities to support student’s studies.
  • Almost all medical colleges in Karnataka have well-qualified teaching faculty members to teach several UG and PG programs and to guide Ph.D. Research.
Benefits for taking admission in medical colleges in Karnataka
  • Medical colleges in Karnataka provide high-quality education and rigorous training to students with ample scope for all-round development to make them excel in their profession.
  • They stimulate inquiry‐led and evidence‐based approaches to creating knowledge and facilitate a vibrant academic ambiance to nurture the intellectual climate.
  • Medical colleges in Karnataka train the students in group discussions, aptitude tests, numerical ability, and technical facets, and conducts mock interviews.
  • They also conduct diverse value-added courses in conjunction with industry partners to make the students ready for placements.
Placement in medical colleges in Karnataka

Almost every medical college in Karnataka are the best placement colleges in Karnataka. The placement department in medical colleges in Karnataka undertakes the following activities to assist students for their career growth:

  • The placement of students in industries is done through campus recruitments, pooled campus, and off-campus recruitments.
  • Medical colleges in Karnataka provide better practical knowledge.
  • They also foster the students to seek opportunities and enhance their learning experience with practical knowledge.
  • They also assist the students by conducting several workshops, guest lectures, and seminars, and also by letting them to participate in several other extra-curricular activities.
FAQ
What is the percentage required for admission to medical colleges in Karnataka?

The students need to secure 50% marks in class 12th in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology to take admission in medical colleges in Karnataka.

 How are students shortlisted for admission to medical colleges in Karnataka?

The merit list is prepared on the basis of marks secured by the students in the NEET entrance exam.

 What is the admission process to apply for medical colleges in Karnataka?

The students can apply to the medical colleges in Karnataka online as well as offline.
